title: Bard's Face/Mask
body: Does anyone else feel that his Face/Mask is a little too small for his body?

replies.body:
I wondered about that myself, as I made Bard-themed cupcakes with teeny tiny marzipan masks to deliver to the team that created Bard.  (I was really jazzed about his abilities and wanted to congratulate them on the announcement.  They were almond flavored, because for some reason I keep thinking that nut-flavored things are his style.)

If you look at the head of Bard, and take into account that magnificent beard and mop of hair, and take the mask to be as tiny as feasible for the face then it just about works?

Image attached - view only if you don't mind nightmares from A) bad paint skillz and B) a creepy Bard face.

It's like if you got a paper plate and cut out holes ONLY for your mouth and eyes, and then trimmed the plate as small as you could make it, without interfering with those holes.  And now I have images of people cosplaying him with paper plate masks and the dead heads of several mops as his hair.

That's assuming Bard even has a head to begin with, and isn't a being made entirely of cosmic power. When he dies the light leaves him and his clothes crumple to the floor, making me think everything about his physical appearance is something of his own design to "fit in" with the people of worlds he visits, particularly Runeterra. He doesn't actually need clothes being made of stardust, but he decided to anyway.
Sounds cool but I think your over-exaggerating things. No doubt he's a spirit creature, but as for his appearance, it's possible that's just how he is :/

I kind of like Sharjo's thought - that Bard is taking physical form so that he can have agency on Runeterra.  Especially if he lives "beyond the physical universe" as the reveal said.  Those mask holes have incredibly bright light shining from them too - maybe he is a big bag of starlight! :D

(Am I wrong in thinking he'd be great to hug?  I realize he's *waaaay* too busy for such petty human concerns, but I'd like to hug a bag of magical starlight.  Also, I could be entirely wrong, and his physical form is indeed the way he has always been.)

^ this basically. If you think about it, chances are he looks kinda like Xerath in terms of overall appearance without his clothes, minus Xerath's sarcophagus of course. Bard seems like he'd understand an appearance like that would intimidate folks, so he decided to dress for his role so people would be more trusting. He gave himself a face with that mask for the sake of being someone others can communicate and interact with.

Also I'd imagine he'd be all about hugs. Also if I'm right and he is a being of star-power, hugging him would probably be one of the single most pleasant things you could experience. Kinda like hugging Lumas from Mario Galaxy, but better.

Man - Mario Galaxy.  I so wanted to try some Star Bits myself - especially when they said they [tasted like honey](http://www.mariowiki.com/Star_Bit#Trivia)!  (Though, not so many that I would transfooooooorm!)

I wonder if Bard wanders Runeterra incognito.  I'd love to see him trudging through a rainy forest, with a little sack of mysterious totems on a stick on his back - the meeps peeking out at him from under waterlogged leaves.  Maybe an old man passes him on the trail, not realizing who he might have just seen, mask hidden by a heavy hood - only to turn around too late and see the sparkles of a fading "Magical Journey" portal.

Perhaps it's kinda like Bloodmoon Skins or Justicar Aatrox. Skins aren't canon of course, at least the vast majority aren't, but the Bloodmoon skins for Kalista, Thresh and Elise exist as some kind of Ionian interpretation of those champions, perhaps born from a Harrowing that Ionia has seen before or been a victim to, and Justicar Aatrox exists as an interpretation of the Darkin as a benevolent entity that came to the aid of nations that now prosper thanks to him. 

For Bard he tailors his physical appearance to better bridge the gap between himself and various cultures, leading to varying interpretations of Bard (appropriate titles included) depending on what region has met him, leading to a wide array of Bards throughout the regions of Runeterra, all with different names and appearances but all following the same basic principles: a wandering soul who appears to steer the world from disaster.

I like that, especially as "[The Wonder Above](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/champion-preview/wonder-above)" teaser said that the constellation went by other names, by other peoples.  One of them being "The Great Caretaker" - so maybe his future skins will be other iterpretations of what different cultures sees a 'great caretaker' would be like?

I like this, makes me wonder what a Shuriman, Freljordian or Demacian Bard would look like.

I imagine the Freljord's Bard would have an even larger beard, to the point where you could legitimately just say "Yeah no that guy's just a beard, nothing else."
[Got your concept art right here!](https://s-media-cache-ak0.pinimg.com/736x/f1/bb/82/f1bb82b85a3c1258968320260bd1e706.jpg)
I love it. especially considering I once played Gomez as part of a high-school musical thing!
That would be cool, but that begs the question? What is the theme behind Elderwood Bard?

In Princess Mononoke the Forest Spirit was what kept a giant forest alive and healthy, and preventing itself from being destroyed by humans. And had some 'celestial being' ideas with it too with it's night/more spirit form.

If you want visual similarities. The wolf girl's mask looks a good bit like Bard's:
Santa Bard confirmed.

This is why I think Bard might be taking someone's place on my top ten champions list. The mystical aspects surrounding him and the potential for who he could be is staggering and though I was a little downtrodden when I learned his VO wasn't actual words it makes fair enough sense.

He's transcended or always has been; shifting the scales of balance and helping others prevent the end from rearing it's empty skull. His kit reflects that and I love it; helping others so they can help themselves. 

I want to hug him. I feel like if you gave him a squeeze it'd be like a bag full of air, and a puff of stardust would float out his mask. He might not hug you back but I think he'd be alright with the affection, an understanding pat on your head as opposed to a smile he couldn't give.

Hey, Ark Angel,

I know there are a lot of questions that get asked around here - and **not being from narrative**, there's a reason I don't even try to answer those questions - I don't have the answers.  People lashing out and being salty is what I expected when I decided to start posting here - I'd lurked long enough to see how much hurt was here.

Please, though - just let me post like another player here.  I can ask to have the 'red' taken off my name if you and others here would prefer.  I'd be just like any other player, and I wouldn't have to preface every post with a disclaimer that I'm not on narrative.

Look man sorry for being hateful. I just came out of a bad game, and the word "agency" set me off as I literally made a dozen post about the lore change on that subject and none of them got any attention from anyone with a certain hue about their name.

Please don't take your red off your name, and please do keep posting here... we need you guys listening and joining in with us...

But the thing is that we, or rather at least me.. yeah I'l just speak for myself here.

I'm so frustrated with the line **"not being from narrative"**. It is like the only people that are even willing to talk to us about things are the people that have no say in them.

And that is more frustrating than the two year of silence we got before the largely unwanted change.

So I guess in short; Sorry for being a dick, please do keep posting it is good to have you around, Can you pass it along that we still need a separate Fanfiction Board, and lastly...

Know that I'm not the only one who is still salty about the removal of player agency in the world. The only reason you didn't get more of a backlash is... well the lore change drove a good % of the community away... some went to CCP some just dropped caring about league lore all together.

Heck I can't even read the new stuff without feeling like it is an affront to some core concept of community interaction. I know that isn't fair or even really rational but yeah... that is where I am.

I get it (and *totally *get coming out of a bad game) - and you weren't being a dick, just totally human.  And I know that there is a lot of bad feeling round here - and that there hasn't been enough done to fix that yet.

I've read the threads - the retcon, the Trundle change, the Xerath change, the too-short bios, the non-arrival of the long-form bios, and more.  I know, but I can't speak to any of them as I literally don't have good info on any of it.  The underlying issue seems to be a near complete erosion of trust - and the desire to be consulted on any future changes comes from a desire to see past mistakes avoided in the future.

I can ask about a separate fan-fiction board, but (and please forgive my ignorance - I'm not as well read on this subject) isn't the Community Creations where a lot of fan-fiction goes right now?  Why a separate board for fiction, compared to art or videos?  I'm not trying to start a fight - I honestly hope you can explain.
I'm not understanding the question.

Sorry - I get a bit wordy.

The question is - why did Ark Angel ask for a separate board for fan-fiction, when the Community Creations board is supposed to be for fan-fiction, fan-art, videos, etc.?

Off topic for a second... and not to be flippant, but  did you know that "Role-Playing" has a board. Although few even know it is there. http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/roleplaying

(Truly Complete aside, but did you know Riot used to host RP'ing events and reds would act as the champs and important characters while the rest of us roleplayed as summoners of various skill, or even just important, or in a lot of cases not so important people of Runeterra...

One of the Hallmark RPs was the release of Maokai... which was RP'd by a grand number of people and was hosted by Feral Pony and Shurelia.

Some fought a dragon... others tried to assist the champs as Maokai rampage through them, still others sought there own goals... was a grand event.)

To really answer your question let me ask you a few in return...

Why does the "League Videos" and "Roleplaying" boards exist?

Wouldn't clearly both fit in "Community Creation"?

I would put forward that it is due to the nature of just how broad "CC" is... that it ends up with people who are there for art but nothing more, and people that want vids but nothing more, people who wish to Roleplay but nothing more, and people that want to write and read fanfiction but nothing more... And that at the end of it all these people just end up stepping on each others feet most of the time.

Post of fanfiction and videos that took hours to make as swept aside by art that someone found cool while doing a google search.

Basically these topic all move at different paces. RP and Fanfiction general benefit from a slower turn over... where as Vids and Art which people can easily see in mere seconds garner many more comments, and thus crowd out the slower moving styles of community creation.

And before anyone says that fanfiction is not worth reading... I challenge them to read this... and maintain that opinion. http://archiveofourown.org/works/1040588?view_full_work=true

Hey Ark (can I call you Ark?)

Your suspicions are correct - I did *not* know there was a roleplaying board!  Nor did I know there was Rioter-hosted champion interaction roleplaying in the past.  Just goes to show how new I am around here.  

While it's not a question relevant to the main point, if you feel like chatting about it, could you tell me how they handled the issues with scale?  Was there a limited number of players who could join in to something like this, or did it self-limit due to time and interest? (I.e. was there ever a problem where a hundred players tried to interact with a name champ player/actor at the same time?  If not, why?)  I'm mostly just curious, as it sounds like an interesting problem.

I was initially confused as to why the roleplay board wouldn't be listed on the main sidebar menu of boards -but I quickly caught myself.  I've run a forum in the past, and keeping trolls (or just people who misunderstand) from messing up a really cool roleplaying thread could be an issue.  Maybe keeping it available, but not shoved in anyone's face, is a good way to pre-filter your playerbase?

Now, I have no idea if the Rioters who run the boards would find it a big deal (for reasons I don't know) to add another board.  They probably also have access to stats showing the frequency and popularity of fan-fiction content posts.  

I can send an email tomorrow to ask them if they think the graph of interest and the graph of difficulty (or time) of implementation overlaps nicely.  *I do not promise any result*, except to ask the question.

Last two things:

1. In your opinion, would a fan-fiction board benefit from NOT being listed on the sidebar, like the role-playing board?
2. Is there a desire for a separate board from the rest of that segment of the community, not just yourself?  I'm not questioning your wishes - just trying to get a handle on whether this is a wish that lots of fan-fic writers and readers want, or it's from a dedicated few.

Ark is fine. ^_^

Figured I'd responded to this separate since it is kind of an aside. But I'll paint the general picture and give an account of the story that unfolded for kicks. ^_^

If I remember correctly, and hold me to none of this, the event was advertised on the RP boards a week in advance of the champ launch and everyone who wished to participate had to fill out a character bio(which is normal for these kinda events and allows for some screening of inappropriate characters.).

Anyway Then the day of the patch, at a certain time there were several threads made that where like "Event Room A" "Event Room B" "Event Room C" and so on and so on. Each player that had an approved Bio was asides a room. the room had rough caps of 10 to 16 or so players. 

It was made clear up front that only Rioters would control champs, and that interaction with champs would be somewhat limited from the Player Characters, at least at the start. Although some of the people playing did play as the summoners summoning the champs to the field... these players however I think where buddies of the reds so idk. XD 

The RP began with everyone entering a kinda press box which overlooked the twisted treeline. At least in my room people were playing everything from Noxain Royals to low level summoners who had managed to scheme enough free time and privileges to get a ticket.

So the way it all worked was that every 15 minutes or so... a Rioter would post an "event" that moved the story along.

The first of these was Ezreal walking into the jungle early and finding Mundo there... who promptly cleaver'd him in the face, and there was the classic lvl1 TT fight. Soraka healing Ez, and then we were given time to have our characters interact.

Then given updates on the match and then strange signs started showing... minions started spawning malformed.... the Dragon began to wonder the map oddly... both Nexus start to glow brightly... the sky grew dark...

We got more time to react, the low level summoners made jokes about how much trouble the people summoning the minions would be in, and a few other thing went happened...

There was a fight for red buff and just as it was about to die...

Maokai manifested, killed all 6 champions on the map by himself(they must have know what he would be like season 4 and 5) and all hell broke loose. The minions started to attack the crowds that where watching the match, dragon also, some went to help the crowds others rushed to aid the champs in subduing Maokai, still others rushed to the Nexus to try and stop them from going out of control.

Some grabbed items from the shop to aid them and in general it was a silly but wild and fun RP that lasted about three or four hours.

The amount of effort put in by the Reds was massive. I'm not sure how many "Rooms" were made but I know I was in "Event Room A" and I had a friend in "Event Room F" who told me about playing a Yordle who was visiting the match on her first trip away from Bandle City.

I guess in short to some extent the event self limited... but the Reds also put some effort in to making sure that it could scale if need be.

As I mentioned to Ark - I managed to make myself misunderstood and that's my fault.  I wasn't, not for one second, suggesting that it wasn't worth doing.  I was (in my own stupid way) reacting to what some might have misunderstood as an absolute statement.

>I'd like to point out that these kinda events are how you engage a player.

Could be misread as "...are how you engage all players." which it wasn't intended to be.  I wanted to modify it to "...are how you engage some players." but I did not mean to diminish its importance at all.

This sounds like a backpedal - but I swear - it's my own stupid fault for being so... so anally retentive, really.  Were we talking in person, I promise I'd be stammering and looking a bit stupid right now.

I didn't mean it wasn't important.  I would like to engage every single player - finding the perfect means of making their experience as rewarding to them as possible.  Different means for different players - some that overlap, and some that don't.

Gonna go boil my own head now.

Hey, Ark,

Had that chat with the guys in charge of the NA Boards today - nice blokes.  They were explaining that the form the boards currently take is not how they'd like to keep them - that with the NA Boards being the first of the new boards system, a bit experimental, there's a bit of happenstance to how the different boards were divided.

They were really keen to discuss the possibility of a fan fiction board - without committing to having one immediately. :)  In fact, they thought that it would be a good idea to get players involved in the inevitable conversations regarding how content creators like fan fiction writers (and other creators) could be best served here.

There's a non-zero chance they'll be turning up to talk about it in a non-geological timeframe, but no firm dates or anything.

Beyond the mechanical side of things, we talked about how we can get more rioters over the fear of taking part over here, how grey and miserable Edinburgh can be on a bad day, and the psychology of content creators.

Honestly, Bard seems like a pretty friendly guy. Heck, just look at his kit:

He spends his spare time going on treasure hunts so he can get more Meeps to pal around with; his W leaves gifts for his allies to feel better; his E sends ANYONE who wants to take it on a Magical Journey of Adventure; Heck, you could even describe his Q as "He wants two people to feel closer to each other".
